snippet: Newly released court documents show that one of the paintings sold by Knoedler and attributed to Jackson Pollock was signed with the artist’s name misspelled.
abstract: Newly released court documents reveal that painting attributed to Jackson Pollack and sold by Knoedler & Company was signed with the artist's name misspelled; discovery is part of continuing civil case accusing firm of selling dozens of multimillion-dollar forgeries.
lead_paragraph: Newly released court documents show that one of the paintings sold by Knoedler and attributed to Jackson Pollock was signed with the artist’s name misspelled.

headline.main: Note to Forgers: Don’t Forget the Spell Check
headline.print_headline: Note to Forgers: Don’t Forget the Spell Check
